    Load a dataset from the Hugging Face Hub!

    Source: R/datasets.R
    hf_load_dataset.Rd

    Function has multiple uses - getting pre-made datasets for exploratory analysis, or to figure as means for evaluating your fine-tuned models.

    hf_load_dataset(
  dataset,
  split = NULL,
  label_conversion = c("str2int", "int2str")
)

    Arguments

    dataset

    The name of a Hugging Face dataset saved on the Hub. Use hf_list_models() to find a dataset.

    split

    Usually one of 'train' , 'test', 'validation' however, check the dataset's meta data at The Hub first.

    label_conversion

    Whether to add an additional column converting labels from str2int or int2str?

    Value

    A Hugging Face data set as a tibble

    See also

    https://huggingface.co/docs/datasets/index

    Examples

    (emotion_all_splits <- hf_load_dataset('emotion'))
#> $test
#> # A tibble: 2,000 × 3
#>    text                                                         label label_name
#>    <chr>                                                        <dbl> <chr>     
#>  1 im feeling rather rotten so im not very ambitious right now      0 sadness

#>  4 i left with my bouquet of red and yellow tulips under my ar…     1 joy       
#>  5 i was feeling a little vain when i did this one                  0 sadness   
#>  6 i cant walk into a shop anywhere where i do not feel uncomf…     4 fear      
#>  7 i felt anger when at the end of a telephone call                 3 anger     
#>  8 i explain why i clung to a relationship with a boy who was …     1 joy       
#>  9 i like to have the same breathless feeling as a reader eage…     1 joy       
#> 10 i jest i feel grumpy tired and pre menstrual which i probab…     3 anger     
#> # … with 1,990 more rows
